page.title: 13PEOPLE AT HARDWICK
page.content: Although at one time the villages were probably populated by families who had lived there for many generations things now seem to be quite different. Several people said they had never lived anywhere else but a large percentage of the area's population were relative newcomers- some only living there as little as three to five years. Obviously, this reflects the fact that farming is no longer the sole occupation of the area. The village atmosphere has, perhaps, been lost to a great extent but is revived on special occasions, like national celebrations when all the residents get together. This situation is perhaps different in Ault Hucknall, where the church forms a focus for the village community.
